notes: First production years of iconic Model T. Introduced October 1908. Planetary transmission operated by three foot pedals. Vanadium steel construction. Hand-crank starting. Brass radiator and fixtures. Requires specialized brass-era expertise and extremely rare parts. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Model T article, January 2025 revision.

Ford Motor Company's first production vehicle. Horizontal opposed twin-cylinder engine mounted under seat. Chain drive. Tiller steering initially, steering wheel added later. Extremely rare brass-era vehicle requiring highly specialized restoration expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Model A (1903â€“04) article, January 2025 revision.

Low-priced runabout that preceded Model T. Four-cylinder engine front-mounted. Planetary transmission. Sold for $500, making it affordable for middle class. Brass-era vehicle requiring specialized vintage expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Model N article, January 2025 revision.

Ford's first six-cylinder model and most expensive early offering at $2,500. Large luxury car competing with upscale brands. Commercial failure that convinced Henry Ford to focus on affordable vehicles. Brass-era complexity requires highly specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Model K article, January 2025 revision.
